title: Orbiting satellites - changing KE elliptical orbit

content.question: A satellite is in an elliptical orbit around a planet, as shown in the figure. Which of the following statements best justifies why the satellite's kinetic energy changes as it orbits the planet?

choices.label: The satellite’s angular momentum has a nonzero magnitude.
The satellite’s angular momentum has the same direction throughout the orbit.
The gravitational force exerted on the satellite by the planet does work on the satellite.
The gravitational forces that the satellite and the planet exert on each other are opposite in direction.

content.answer: The gravitational force exerted on the satellite by the planet does work on the satellite.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
